summary: This is an email from defense attorney Christian Everdell to Judge Nathan and others, transmitting Ghislaine Maxwell's pretrial motions and exhibits for filing under seal in her criminal case. It indicates the submission of both redacted and unredacted versions of the motions.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP sending Ghislaine Maxwell's pretrial motions and exhibits to the court and government for filing under seal.

persons.name: Bobbi C Sternheim
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding the filing of pretrial motions in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Pagliuca
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding the filing of pretrial motions in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding the filing of pretrial motions in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The federal judge presiding over U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom the pretrial motions are being submitted.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)); her defense team is submitting pretrial motions and exhibits.

connections.description: Everdell is part of the legal team submitting pretrial motions on behalf of defendant Maxwell.
Menninger is copied on the email regarding Maxwell's pretrial motions, indicating she is part of the defense legal team.
Everdell is formally submitting legal documents to the presiding judge in the case.
Both are legal professionals involved in the case correspondence.
Both are legal professionals copied on the case correspondence, likely part of the same defense team.

events.title: Filing of Maxwell's Pretrial Motions
events.description: Defense attorney Christian Everdell submits redacted and unredacted versions of Ghislaine Maxwell's pretrial motions and exhibits to the court for filing under seal.

locations: 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY (Cohen & Gresser LLP office)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team was actively filing pretrial motions in her criminal case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)) as of January 2021.
The motions and exhibits were submitted in both redacted and unredacted versions, with the unredacted versions to be filed under seal.
The volume of materials was substantial, requiring transmission in multiple zip files.
The correspondence confirms Judge Nathan was the presiding judge in the Maxwell case at that time.
The defense legal team included attorneys from Cohen & Gresser LLP, specifically Christian Everdell, and others copied on the email.
